MyProjects.title: NetflixGPT
MyProjects.desc: NetflixGPT is an AI-powered streaming platform inspired by Netflix, built to offer an enhanced movie discovery experience. While it functions as a Netflix clone with a sleek UI and movie listings, the standout feature is its AI-based search system.Using the TMDB API, the app fetches detailed and up-to-date movie data, including titles, posters, genres, and overviews. The integrated Gemini AI API powers an intelligent search experience, allowing users to describe their mood or interests in natural language (e.g., “feel-good rom-coms with travel themes”), and receive personalized recommendations that match those preferences. This blend of a rich movie database with conversational AI makes NetflixGPT a smart and intuitive platform for content discovery.

MyProjects.title: Bloggy
MyProjects.desc:
Bloggy is a modern blog publishing platform designed for simplicity and efficiency. The website allows users to explore a variety of blog posts, with content generated using Gemini AI to ensure high-quality, engaging writing.
To manage content seamlessly, Bloggy features an integrated Admin Dashboard, where administrators can create, edit, and delete blog posts, manage categories, and oversee user activity. The platform is built for scalability and content freshness, making it ideal for individual writers, publishers, or businesses looking to maintain a consistent online presence.

MyCaseStudies.title: Boosting a Local Tea Stall Business During COVID
MyCaseStudies.context: Local tea stall facing low sales during the COVID-19 lockdown.
problem: Drop in revenue due to COVID restrictions
Customer hesitancy towards unpacked or factory snacks
MyCaseStudies.solution: Introduced handmade, organic, plastic-free packaged snacks to be sold with tea combos. Leveraged local women cooks and sustainable packaging.
features: Traditional South Indian snacks (Ragi Murukku, Millet Laddu)
myRole: Created snack product line and branding
Sourced from local cooks and farmers

MyCaseStudies.title: Siva E-Corner – Digitizing Access to Government Services
MyCaseStudies.context: Local e-service center lacked digital presence and customers struggled to know which documents and charges applied to which government service.
problem: No central listing of services or required documents
Wasted visits due to missing information
MyCaseStudies.solution: Built a clean and mobile-friendly website showing all services, fees, required documents, and processing time – with WhatsApp booking support.
features: Search and filter services (e.g., PAN, community certificate)
Show service fee, documents, and time required
WhatsApp deep link for service booking
results: Fewer wasted visits; customers came prepared
Link sharing enabled wider access to services
learnings: Clarity and transparency improve user experience
Simple digital tools can create big local impact
Designing for low-tech users needs empathy
Strong UX reduces service time and confusion
myRole: Identified user pain points through observation
Developed frontend using HTML, CSS, JS
Trained staff to use and promote the website
